description:
March 21, 2020: 
Nationwide curfew imposed. The Libyan Presidential Council of the Government of National Accord (GNA) has announced a curfew across Libya starting March 22 from 6.00 p.m. to 6.00 a.m. The curfew excluded security, health workers and other people involved in pharmacy services, environmental work, energy, telecommunications and cargo.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On March 22, 2020, Libya declared country-wide curfew, which "is from 6pm until 6am," closing "all mosques at all prayer times, educational institutions, cafes, restaurants, events halls, clubs, entertainment centres and commercial outlets" during curfew hours.

The decree also states that "curfew breakers will be liable to punishment under existing laws."
On March 22, the High Committee against the Corona Virus imposes a curfew from 6:00 PM to 6:00 AM.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
6pm to 6am curfew set by government; 

Adapted on March 30 to 2pm to 7am and work hours limited from 9.00-12.00

Update March 22: 
The Ministry of Interior has warned that anyone who violates quarantine measures or the curfew imposed as part of the measures to prevent a coronavirus outbreak in Libya could be jailed up to six months or fined up of 200 dinars.

"Those who violate any legitimate order issued by the authorities in order to preserve public safety and health will face a punishment of one month". UPDATE: Originally no explicit mention of repercussions of curfew violators, now there is.
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines

description:
In Libya on April 21, 2020, "The Deputy Foreign Minister of the internationally recognized Libyan government based in Tripoli, Mahmoud Al-Tilisi, said yesterday that the committee formed to repatriate Libyans stranded abroad as a result of border closures to mitigate the spread of the Coronavirus (Covid-19) had started the repatriation process."

"committee began its work by reaching out to Libyan consulates and heads of missions and embassies abroad to provide the necessary health care as well as accommodation and subsistence services for stranded citizens."

"work of the committee is divided into two phases. The first phase of this process includes the provision of housing for quarantine and health care and subsistence services. The second phase includes real-time PCR (polymerise chain reaction) detection procedures, as well as quarantine procedures."
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
The Libyan Interior Ministry's Coronavirus task force announced a lockdown during the Eid Al-Fitr days. 

The Interior Ministry urged the residents not to go out except for necessities and to abide by cooperation with the relevant authorities to preserve their safety, instructing security apparatuses to fine and take legal procedures against the violators. Libya will see 24-hour lockdown on the three days of Eid Al-Fitr from Sunday to Tuesday.
